course_title: Special Topics MESAS-200 Level: The New Jew
class_notes:
(Same as JS 275W 1) Topic: The New Jew


The "New Jew" is a transformed historical figure; (roughly), the antithesis of the pre-Enlightenment "Old European Jew" , who was confined to pales, ghettoes and cohesive communities; bound to the House of Study (belief and practices), and deprived from participation in central histories and cultures.
This course is a literary survey of this mythological figure since its inception in theoretical documents, stories and poems, translated into English.
course_description: Special topics in Middle Eastern and South Asian Studies, at the 200 level; may be repeated when content varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 3185, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:20a-12:35p, Instructor: O. Yeglin, Status: Open
